vpidaparthi wrote:
>> I am completely a novice to JFCUnits. Here is my question. Is it
>> possible to write JFCUnits without intruding into the actual code
>> we are testing?

Ilja Preuss Tue, 13 Dec 2005 09:38:10 +0100
> Don't use JFCUnit, use Jemmy - it's much simpler. It allows you to
> find components based on a number of different criterions. In fact
> you can even write your own (it uses the Strategy pattern for this).

For questions regarding JFCUnit, Jemmy, and the several other Java GUI
test frameworks, consider

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/java-gui-testing/
